intro: Eschscholzia leptandra, commonly known as the slender poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known poppies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its flowers are small and pale yellow, often with a distinctive, narrow shape. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
